newsitem.title: UK: Russian gas oil exports by sea dive 40 pct in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Russian gas oil exports by sea dive 40 pct in Sept.

text.p: Russian seaborne gas oil exports slumped by over 40 percent in September as an increase in rail and pipeline tariffs curtailed deliveries to all major ports, port officials said on Wednesday.

Shipments from the Latvian port of Ventspils, the Russian ports of Novorossiisk and Tuapse, and the Ukrainian port of Odessa totalled 848,000 tonnes in September, against 1.455-million tonnes in August.
Exports from Ventspils on the Baltic Sea fell by 132,000 tonnes to 507,000 tonnes, while the three Black Sea ports shipped 341,000 tonnes, a drop of 199,000 tonnes on August.
On September 1 Russia raised rail and pipeline transit tariffs to the ports, a Ventspils spokesman said.
"I'd say transport costs of coming to the port have increased by 10 percent on the Russian side," he said.
But fuel oil exports from the four ports climbed 84,000 tonnes in September to 583,000 tonnes, after a sharp fall in exports in August.
On the Black Sea, Novorossiisk fuel shipments were up 46,000 tonnes at 176,000, shipments from Tuapse more than doubled to 157,000 tonnes while Odessa exported 19,000 tonnes less at 185,000.
Fuel oil exports from Ventspils fell by 13,000 tonnes to 65,000 tonnes.
